subject: Programming
title: Why Open Source Won
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Why Open Source Won.

hook.text: In 2001, Microsoft's CEO called Linux a threat. Today Microsoft runs on open source.

buildup.text: Open source won because collaboration scales better than secrecy in a connected world.

discovery.text: The internet itself was built on open protocols and open software. Openness is in its DNA.

twist.text: Open source didn't kill proprietary software. Both coexist. But open source sets the default.

climax.text: From hobbyist rebellion to industry standard, open source proved sharing creates more than hoarding.

punchline.text: Sharing code changed the world. It always will.

quiz.question: Why did open source ultimately succeed?
options: It was always cheaper to develop
